name: copy-ruby-reference
description: A simple VSCode extension that parses the Ruby AST and allows you to right click on a constant definition and copy a reference to it.

scripts.build-and-package-darwin-arm64: npm run build-darwin-arm64 && vsce package --target darwin-arm64
scripts.build-and-package-darwin-x64: npm run build-darwin-x64 && vsce package --target darwin-x64
scripts.build-and-package-linux-x64: npm run build-linux-x64 && vsce package --target linux-x64
scripts.build-and-package-win32-x64: npm run build-win32-x64 && vsce package --target win32-x64
scripts.build-and-package-and-publish-darwin-arm: npm run build-and-package-darwin-arm64 && vsce publish --target darwin-arm64
scripts.build-and-package-and-publish-darwin-x64: npm run build-and-package-darwin-x64 && vsce publish --target darwin-x64
scripts.build-and-package-and-publish-linux-x64: CARGO_TARGET_X86_64_UNKNOWN_LINUX_GNU_LINKER=x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu-gcc npm run build-and-package-linux-x64 && vsce publish --target linux-x64
scripts.build-and-package-and-publish-win32-x64: npm run build-and-package-win32-x64 && vsce publish --target win32-x64
scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run lint
